sentences.english: Both has the fertile soil fertile farmland, bumper grain harvest, and has the broad prairie, a hundred flowers in full bloom.

sentences.english: The centuries-old Qilu culture has nurtured this vast fertile land.

sentences.english: I'm the hot wind from the desert, the black soil on the plains.

sentences.english: In the spring, we plunge shovels into the garden plot, turn under the dark compost.

sentences.english: Grateful heart is the heart in which seed of bhakti will grow.

sentences.english: The old peasant said these seedlings should be bedded out in rich soil.

sentences.english: The scale of fertile soil projects shall be expanded, thus to enhance the quality of the tillable land.

sentences.english: Small growths called polyps, as well as cancers, also favour this site.

sentences.english: I know to what brown country.

sentences.english: The river deposits rich soil at its bends.

sentences.english: We are lucky to grow on this promising land—Xianghua Primary School.

definition: to take root/to establish a base
plowing and weeding/farm work/fig. to work or study diligently
to be rooted to/to take root in

to be pregnant/to produce offspring/to nurture (a development, school of thought, artwork etc)/fig. replete with (culture etc)
